sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Russian President Vladimir Putin imposes strict military controls in occupied Ukrainian territories as Moscow-appointed authorities in Kherson order residents to evacuate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Civilians in Kiev forced to take cover as Russian drone strikes continue on the Ukrainian capital.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Pressure mounts on UK Prime Minister Liz Truss after Home Secretary resigns and chaotic Parliament scenes before vote on fracking.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Unanimously, the Russian Federation Council has voted in favour of introducing martial law in Ukraine's occupied territories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: 159 members endorsed the controversial measure, which was announced hours earlier by President Vladimir Putin, in a bid to end the resistance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Decent sabotage groups into our territory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian special forces organized the explosion on the Crimea bridge, as well as terrorist attacks in other Russian regions, including in places of mass gatherings connected to transport energy, as well as, I want to underline, nuclear power facilities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Outside of parliament buildings on the streets of Moscow, residents reacted to Putin's martial law order.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Their feedback was mixed you need to protect your territories their annexation is Ukraine's aggression not ours it is right to protect your people especially since it's part of Russia I think it's very strange there is fighting going on now that's understandable.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But to put it mildly, I don't really believe in this referendum.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The drastic escalation of the conflict coincides with the beginning of Russia's mass relocation of 60,000 civilians from Kherson, where Moscow-installed authorities are bracing for a Ukrainian assault to take it back. But Zelensky's administration is reluctant to call it an evacuation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: We understand that the evacuation is equal to deportation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Its purpose is to create a kind of panic in Kherson.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The martial law declaration comes as Ukrainian troops continue to make gains on the southern front. Officials in Kiev say Putin's announcement doesn't change anything for the war-torn country and it will continue to de-occupy its territories. There's been no let-up in the bombardment by Russian missiles and so-called

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: kamikaze drones on Ukrainian cities. Residents take cover where they can, but in the capital Kyiv it's in underpasses.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: There's an air raid now, and according to the rules of the company I work for, they said to go down for safety, and we've been sitting here for about three hours.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: In fact, it's not as scary as it was in February.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: In fact, the more these kamikaze drones, the more missiles are launched, the more I just get angry. But there's little doubt of the destruction the drones leave behind. The Ukrainian military say they're managing to intercept many, but with Ukraine's critical energy infrastructure taking a pounding Moscow has attracted international condemnation Ursula von der Leyen the head of the European Commission has called Russia's strikes acts of pure terror that amount to war crimes targeted attacks on civilian infrastructure with a clear aim to cut off men women children of children of water, electricity and heating with the winter coming, these are acts of pure terror.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: And we have to call it as such.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The EU plans to impose sanctions on three senior Iranian military commanders and the company that develops the drones.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The move indicates EU ministers do not believe Iran's denials that it has supplied Russia with the low-flying lethal weapons.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: At a closed UN Security Council session, Russia and Iran's representatives denied the use of Iranian-made drones in the war in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: More drama surrounds UK Prime Minister Liz Truss, who is under fire from all corners of Parliament.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: She lost another senior cabinet member in a week and ended the day with a parliamentary vote descending into acrimony and chaos.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The opposition was quick to pounce.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: 45p tax cut, gone.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Corporation tax cut, gone.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: 20p tax cut, gone.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Two year energy freeze, gone. Tax free shopping, gone. sentences.sentence: Maen nhw i gyd wedi'u ddod, felly pam y mae hi ar hyn o bryd? She's still here. Mr Speaker, I am a fighter and not a quitter.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: I have acted in the national interest to make sure that we have economic stability.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Then came the news that our Home Secretary, Suella Braverman, had quit, but not before sending a resignation letter lambasting the Prime Minister.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: In her resignation, Braverman says, Pretending we haven't made mistakes, carrying on as if everyone can't see that we have made them and hoping that things will magically come right is not serious politics.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: I have made a mistake.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: I accept responsibility, I resign. An evening parliamentary vote on the issue of fracking ended with angry scenes and accusations of bullying. Conservative party whips allegedly forced their own MPs to back the government in what they said was a confidence vote to Truss. Truss' grip on power is slipping by the day according to political observers. With tensions as high as they are, there is rising speculation Tory MPs are plotting a no-confidence vote.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: UK MP Ian Duncan Smith says the British government should expel Chinese diplomats if they were involved in an attack on a Hong Kong protester who says he was beaten inside the compound of the Chinese consulate in Manchester.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: As I said to the government, I must say categorically, anybody involved in those scenes is not welcome here.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: If it's the consul themselves, they must go and they should have hauled the ambassador and that's the key thing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Haul the ambassador and tell the ambassador we want a full apology and these people are persona non grata, they're going home. We'll never tolerate that on British soil.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Protester Bob Chan backed the call for action.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It's very disturbing. This incident reflects that Chinese consulate staff have totally no regard for the law. I believe the UK is a very safe place with freedom of speech.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: That consulate staff can so brazenly pull someone inside and beat them up in broad daylight is unimaginable.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: It's shocking and this shouldn't happen." Amateur footage of the protest shows Bob Chan on the ground inside the Chinese consulate, being beaten by consulate staff.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: China's Ministry of Foreign Affairs claims a protester was there illegally and had quote the security of the Chinese diplomatic premises.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: On Wednesday, the president's office said that political consultations to form the new government will be held between today and tomorrow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Under the constitution, the president has to consult with all the main political leaders before he can invite election winners to form the new cabinet.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Well, in this case, the right-wing coalition led by Giorgia Meloni.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And if everything goes as planned, the cabinet and the new cabinet could be sworn in sometime between Saturday and Monday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: But despite their decision to present themselves as a united front during political consultations, allied leaders seem more divided than ever. And that's following a recent row between Berlusconi and Meloni. And tensions have been refilled lately between the two, especially after the former prime minister's recent statements of support for Russian President Vladimir Putin, something that did not go down well with Giorgio Meloni who said that Italy is part of the EU and the NATO alliance and warned that whoever doesn't agree with this cannot be part of the government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Giorgio Orlandi for Euronews in Rome.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Former US President Donald Trump answered questions under oath in a lawsuit filed by a magazine columnist who says he raped her in the mid-1990s in a department store dressing room.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Wednesday's deposition gave E. Jean Carroll's lawyers a chance to question Trump about the alleged assault, as well as statements he made in 2019 when she told her story publicly for the first time.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Trump has called Carroll's rape allegation a hoax and a lie.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Anything Trump said or shared could potentially be used as evidence in an upcoming civil trial.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: He does not face any criminal charges related to Carroll's allegations and any prosecution is currently unlikely.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: That's because the deadline for criminal charges over alleged sexual assaults that occurred in the 1990s has long expired.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Similar legal deadlines also apply to civil lawsuits claiming sexual assault.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: As a result, Carol chose to sue Trump for defamation for denying any wrongdoing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: She says his public denial damaged her reputation, credibility and character.
